description: Blue finance domain concepts for knowledge graph traversal

concepts.name: Blue Carbon Sequestration
concepts.description: The process by which coastal and marine ecosystems capture and store atmospheric CO2 in biomass and sediments, creating long-term carbon sinks

concepts.name: Coastal Protection Services
concepts.description: Ecosystem-based coastal defense provided by reefs, mangroves, and seagrasses that attenuate waves, reduce storm surge, and prevent erosion

concepts.name: Marine Tourism Economics
concepts.description: Economic value generation through reef tourism, dive operations, and marine ecotourism driven by ecosystem health and biodiversity

concepts.name: Fisheries Production
concepts.description: Fish biomass accumulation and spillover from protected areas supporting commercial and artisanal fisheries

concepts.name: Carbon Credit Markets
concepts.description: Voluntary and compliance carbon markets that monetize blue carbon sequestration through verified carbon credits

concepts.name: Biodiversity Value
concepts.description: Economic and insurance value of marine biodiversity including species richness, functional diversity, and genetic resources

concepts.name: MPA Effectiveness
concepts.description: Measurable ecological and economic outcomes of Marine Protected Areas including biomass recovery, spillover, and ecosystem resilience

concepts.name: Ecosystem Restoration
concepts.description: Active restoration of degraded coastal ecosystems including mangrove replanting, coral gardening, and seagrass reseeding with measurable ROI

concepts.name: Climate Resilience
concepts.description: Capacity of marine ecosystems to resist and recover from climate impacts including warming, acidification, and extreme weather events

concepts.name: Nature-Based Solutions Finance
concepts.description: Financial mechanisms for funding marine ecosystem conservation and restoration including green/blue bonds, impact investing, and blended finance

concepts.name: Trophic Cascade Economics
concepts.description: Economic value of trophic cascades where predator recovery drives ecosystem-wide benefits including carbon sequestration and fisheries productivity

concepts.name: Habitat Degradation Risk
concepts.description: Financial risk from ecosystem degradation including reef bleaching, mangrove deforestation, and seagrass loss leading to service value decline

concepts.name: Blue Bond Instruments
concepts.description: Debt instruments specifically structured to fund ocean conservation, sustainable fisheries, and marine ecosystem restoration

concepts.name: Reef Insurance Mechanisms
concepts.description: Parametric insurance products that fund rapid reef restoration after storm damage, triggered by wind speed or wave height thresholds

concepts.name: TNFD Disclosure Framework
concepts.description: Task Force on Nature-related Financial Disclosures framework for reporting on nature-related risks, impacts, and dependencies
